actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on December 12, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Ms. Tenney moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.

The House received a communication from the Honorable Ted Lieu. Mr. Lieu submitted his resignation from the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology. The resignation was accepted without objection.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The House observed a moment of silence in remembrance of the victims of the recent shooting in Las Vegas, Nevada.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 376
actions-list.actionItem: 15 (Roll no. 709).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 6503 — "To amend title 49, United States Code, to extend authorizations for the airport improvement program, to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend the funding and expenditure authority of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 320
actions-list.actionItem: 71, 1 Present (Roll no. 708).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 5378 — "To promote price transparency in the health care sector, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 394
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 707).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 3224 — "To amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to extend the authorization of the Countering Weapons of Mass Destruction Office of the Department of Homeland Security, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced that the unfinished business was on the motions to suspend the rules, which were debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 11.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 6:30 P.M. today.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3226.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Guthrie moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3226 — "To reauthorize the Prematurity Research Expansion and Education for Mothers who deliver Infants Early Act."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 2787.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Latta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 2787 — "To authorize the Federal Communications Commission to process applications for spectrum licenses from applicants who were successful bidders in an auction before the authority of the Commission to conduct auctions expired on March 9, 2023."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4531.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Guthrie moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4531 — "To reauthorize certain programs that provide for opioid use disorder prevention, recovery, and treatment, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5378.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mrs. Rodgers (WA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5378 — "To promote price transparency in the health care sector, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1042.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Rodgers (WA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1042 — "To prohibit the importation into the United States of unirradiated low-enriched uranium that is produced in the Russian Federation, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3224.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. D'Esposito moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3224 — "To amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to extend the authorization of the Countering Weapons of Mass Destruction Office of the Department of Homeland Security, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6503.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Graves (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 6503 — "To amend title 49, United States Code, to extend authorizations for the airport improvement program, to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend the funding and expenditure authority of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5473.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Graves (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5473 — "To amend certain laws relating to disaster recovery and relief with respect to the implementation of building codes, and for other purposes."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 11.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess for a period of less than 15 minutes.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5524.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Nunn (IA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5524 — "To amend the start date of the pilot program on sharing with foreign branches, subsidiaries and affiliates."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5119.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Nunn (IA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5119 — "To amend title 31, United States Code, to provide small businesses with additional time to file beneficial ownership information, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 788.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 788 — "To amend the Permanent Electronic Duck Stamp Act of 2013 to allow States to issue fully electronic stamps under that Act, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2839.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 2839 — "To amend the Siletz Reservation Act to address the hunting, fishing, trapping, and animal gathering rights of the Confederated Tribes of Siletz Indians, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 2747.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Steil moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 2747 — "To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to extend the Administrative Fine Program for certain reporting violations."

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on December 7, 2023, at 3:37 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 3250. Appointment: Member of the Commission on the Social Status of Black Men and Boys and Member of the Commission on Reforem and Modernization of the Department of State.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3315.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Moran moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 3315 — "To exempt for an additional 4-year period, from the application of the means-test presumption of abuse under chapter 7, qualifying members of reserve components of the Armed Forces and members of the National Guard who, after September 11, 2001, are called to active duty or to perform a homeland defense activity for not less than 90 days."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Moran to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Rear Admiral Gregory Todd, Chief of Chaplains, United States Navy, Washington, DC
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 11.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Derrick Van Orden to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
